text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Beheira Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Flag_of_Behira_Govenorate.JPG | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Coat of Arms of Behira Govenorate.png | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Beheira in Egypt.svg | map_caption = Beheira Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Damanhur (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 9,826 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 6277000 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} Beheira Governorate is a governorate in Egypt. The capital is Damanhur. In 2017, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sissi appointed the first female governor in the country's history, Nadia Abdo, for Beheira's Governorate. ==Cities and towns== *Abu Hummus *Abu El Matamir *Damanhur *Edku *El Delengat *El Mahmoudiyah *El Rahmaniya *Itay El Barud *Hosh Issa *Kafr El Dawwar *Koum Hamada *Rosetta *Shubrakhit *Wadi El Natrun ==References== Category:Governorates of Egypt
title: Beheira Governorate
